name: Wilson Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 days 5 nights, arriving very early from NY. The closest public transportation in the immediate area around the hotel is the bus. Metro is about a 10/15 min walk. Buy the T-10 pass at the Metro station to use on the bus and metro station. We managed to use the Aerobus from the airport and got off at Plaza Universidad to catch the 64. From there we had to walk a few blocks. Street names are not very visible so its helpful to know what the surroundings look like. Use Google Maps for this!
reviews.title: chic and modern boutique hotel with nice location near great shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very close to great shopping - Zara, BCBG, Blanco, Loewes and more. If you walk in the other direction on Ave Diagonal you will come across shops for home design.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great location.

reviews.text: We also took advantage of the large pedestrian/biking pathway that sits in the middle of the main road separating traffic. It was great to start our day with an early morning jog from our hotel all the way down avingdua diagonal.
reviews.title: Ugh.....pass.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk is very nice but some of them do not speak/understand english very well. If you are going to use the tour bus, buy your tickets at a discount from the front desk.
reviews.title: Great, but don't stay on first floor

reviews.text: Our room was a standard room on the 5th floor facing the back of the hotel across what seemed to be a small architect school and church. Our balcony was small but large enough that they fit 2 chairs and a table out there. We made use of this when enjoying a cup of coffee in the morning. I was pleased to find our bed was not 2 small beds pushed together which was the case when we travelled to Ibiza and Madrid. The room itself is very small with a small desk, lounge chair, mini fridge with drinks for purchase, closet and safe box. The safe box uses a key that you have to obtain from the front desk.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice. No complaints
Electricity problem or overbooked?
reviews.text: When we arrived at 11pm, we were quite exhausted, because the way from the metro to the hotel takes about 20 Minutes when carrying luggage. At the check-in we were then told that our prepaid room is not available, because there is an electricity problem. We were then offered a room at HCC Covadonga (aboth 500 metres away, but not the rooms are not as nice). Nevertheless, I have a strong feeling that the hotel was overbooked and that there was not really an electricity problem. It seems we were not the only one facing this "electricity problem"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as we wanted to be away from the main tourist area (mainly Las Ramblas) in order to get a good night's sleep. Contrary to other reviews on here we found our room to be lovely and quiet and dark. Its location on Av. Diagonal is perfect if you like walking (although I believe there are buses from outside). We happily walked to the seafront, La Sagrada Familia and Nou Camp all from the hotel. After a hard day's walking around the city, it was really nice to come back to a quality air-conditioned room.
reviews.title: Great hotel for exploring Barcelona

reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the more upmarket area of the city, where there are plenty of nice bars and restaurants and a handy bakery for breakfast on the go just around the corner!
reviews.title: Great location - good value

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful and the free Internet access in reception was a useful service. Despite a slight mix-up with our airport transfer on arrival (for which the staff were apologetic; I would suggest confirming with the hotel a few days in advance of your stay), I cannot fault this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona.
reviews.title: Very cute hotel - but traffic noise!

reviews.text: After the initial disappointment of a rather dark and dismal interior room with twin beds (we booked a double) we were pleased with our room once moved. Great views of Av Diagonal. This is really well placed hotel for restaurants bars cafes etc. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Beware - rooms are far from soundproof.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in april with two friends. We all shared a room - a junior suite. The room was in good condition. We couldn't really complain about anything. It was all clean and tidy. The only small detail we would point out is that the walls need to be painted. As for us being 3 people in a room, one problem occured. The bathroomdoor was of glass, so it wasn't quite handy given the fact that we were 1 girl and 2 boys - but we made it work.
reviews.title: Great hotel - great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and ready to help and answer our questions.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel on the Diagonal

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was great! It is definetly in the luxurious end of Barcelona. It was a ten-minute walk to metro Passeig de Gracia from where we could take the train to placa catalunya where all the action happends. Placa Catalunya is 20 minutes away by feet if you like walking. The weather was great so we didn't mind.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel and good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also if you like shopping than this area of the town is absolutley perfect, with all the high-end shops being close to the hotel.
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.text: You get great value for the money at this hotel!
reviews.title: Upset that Wifi did not work in room....cigarette smoke smell from the reception area at night......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, modern decor, excellent rain shower. Quiet despite being on a busy road. Outside of all the main tourist areas, so need to be prepared for some walking. Only other negative was the lady at reception who was, on every occasion we spoke to her, totally miserable, rest of the staff were friendly though.
reviews.title: Nice place, good price, a bit far from the action

reviews.text: Beautifull hotel, clean room with very good beds. Braekfast is also very good but there are also al lot of places nearby with good breakfast. The Bus Touristique stops nearby, which is great because not everything we wanted to visit was within walking distance. Staff was very kind and helpfull. Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the top room on the tip off the building which gave us windows on 3 sides and even a full balcony...what a view of the city! Room was spotless and smelled great...sheets were soft. Service and ownership A1. Just a very special place.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.text: ”This doesn’t look like the photos on the hotel’s web site”, was my first reaction. Later I realized that the shape of the house probably makes a variety of the rooms inevitable.
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was at the back, which made it slightly dark but also very quiet. The space was enought for me and my two teenage kids. There was a bed room and one extra room which had the odd combination of a couch turned into bed for my son, a closet, and the washing area. Behind a glass door there was the toilet and the shower. Comfortable for the three of us, but maybe not if you are shy.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wilson!

description: This stylish boutique hotel, refurbished in 2008, is located at the most central leafy Barcelona boulevard, Avinguda Diagonal, a convenient place for seeing all that the city has to offer. The hotel’s light and airy rooms all have contemporary, elegant decor. Extra comfort is provided by the nearby metro, train and tourist bus lines, making exploring the city easy.
